text:
:confused: no… you _could_ technically embed it in the article itself (though I’ve not tried this myself), but you would have to do that one every single article, which would be a real pain.
What tracking code are you wanting to place in KB?
I’ve seen this type of functionality, I think it’s usually done using a third party cookie manager like Cookiebot or similar. I’ve not seen it done using only the HubSpot cookie options.

We have been playing around with creating custom objects and do not see an option to associate a custom object to a deal or company. The sidebar only shows “Contacts” and “Attachments”. Are we missing something? <@UCB65TU00>
No, I haven’t heard of any issues like this. If your portal is a paid account with support options, I would recommend reaching out to the support team for help.
NVM, it was something that had to be adjusted via the API call. :dart:
Anyone know if there's a way to customize/brand HubSpot Meetings pages beyond the default portal settings?
Thanks <@UGY22E2KC>, <@U2H3TT8F2> help me out with this :)

Hey <@UFBNA9K9A> I'll send you my error messages. I'm on the createOrUpdateCompanies branch. When I run docker-compose up --build I notice this message:
tep 5/9 : RUN yarn install --frozen-lockfile
 ---> Running in 2cdbeaeec28e
yarn install v1.17.3
[1/4] Resolving packages...
[2/4] Fetching packages...
info There appears to be trouble with your network connection. Retrying...
info There appears to be trouble with your network connection. Retrying...
info There appears to be trouble with your network connection. Retrying...
info fsevents@2.1.2: The platform "linux" is incompatible with this module.
info "fsevents@2.1.2" is an optional dependency and failed compatibility check. Excluding it from installation.
info fsevents@1.2.9: The platform "linux" is incompatible with this module.
info "fsevents@1.2.9" is an optional dependency and failed compatibility check. Excluding it from installation.
[3/4] Linking dependencies...
warning " > @testing-library/user-event@7.2.1" has unmet peer dependency "@testing-library/dom@>=5".
warning "react-scripts > @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin > tsutils@3.17.1" has unmet peer dependency "typescript@>=2.8.0 || >= 3.2.0-dev || >= 3.3.0-dev || >= 3.4.0-dev || >= 3.5.0-dev || >= 3.6.0-dev || >= 3.6.0-beta || >= 3.7.0-dev || >= 3.7.0-beta".
But when it completes I'll send you screenshot of what I see at my end. Rebuilding again, I see something but it's not entirely working for me :disappointed:.
At the beginning I do see this:

You could create a website page and use the meetings module.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/hubdb-rich-text-area-limited-to-65000-characters-and-a-new-meetings-module>

The meeting details are loaded in an iFrame but it enables you to control the content around the meeting controls
Is there a email media query beta in the works? A recommendation for how to best handle it now? `<style></style>` inside of a custom module ok?
isn't there a new hubl tag that allows me to pull things into the head? does that work for email
anyone remember what that's called?
Ok dumb mistake on my end. If you add `const _HubSpot_ = _require_("@HubSpot/api-client");` to the top of of `./HubSpot_service/src/server.js` you should be able run your build again have it work
feel free to PR into the repo to get credit for the fix, otherwise I’m happy to make the change

We are an Agency that does WP and HS development, we lost some developers recently and are looking to contract a HS developer to help us out.  We don't want to use another agency would rather keep the project in house and contract out a developer, can anybody point me to the best place to look for someone like this??
Great, that error went away! I get this new error message:
I also see these messages, fallocate:: Operation not supported as in the below screenshot
hmm interesting, are you ona windows machine by chance?  This thread seems to indicate you need to `BROWSER=none` in cront of the react start scripts or to the .env file
I'm on a windows machine that's correct
I installed docker for windows
apparently it’s not as OS agnostic as I would have hoped
Not sure if those database errors you showed are an issue or not
as long as the service isn’t exiting, I think it’s ok

no worries, if I run it on linux machine on EC2 instance in AWS, will it run fine? I just added this line to .env file:
BROWSER=none

so it looks like this:
CLIENT_ID=<left out for security reasons>
CLIENT_SECRET=<left out for security reasons>
SCOPES=contacts
BASE_URL=<http://localhost:3000>
NODE_ENV=development
CHOKIDAR_USEPOLLING=true
KAFKA_BROKER_LIST=localhost:9092
BROWSER=none
I see this now, and I signed up
but got a message below
message saying uh oh something went wrong
after I sign up
i see this in the console in visual studio code:
I'm able to connect to HS actually but after you connect to HS, what does the app do. Does it pull the information from HS. I see something like this:
just curious what happens after connecting to HS, does it do something like get the data from HS, like contacts?
or how to use the app
I just added one random entry just to see what it does
Thanks man, unfortunately in this case the client has two brand domains and wanted the colors to be unique for each brand sharing the portal. Would be great if this would be an option in the future
sorry, had to jump on call. The walkthrough text should tell you roughly what to expect at each stage. ONce you are done, it will let you create contacts through the app that get synced to HubSpot

Great, I'll start on part 2, i see part 2 of the tutorial does the synching. I'll just submitted the pull request ; I'm not sure if I did it correctly. I'm looking at this branch (createOrUpdateCompanies). I made a comment about PR.

I need to migrate a blog and its content/styles from `<http://blog.example.com|blog.example.com>` to `<http://blog.example.org|blog.example.org>` Is there documentation on migrating a blog from one domain to another? I couldn't find much.

(For the record, we own both root domains ... `<http://example.com|example.com>` and `<http://example.org|example.org>` ... and they're both set up as HubSpot sites, so that part is complete at least.) Thanks in advance for any help!
